name: Propensity to Plan Survey
description: A measure of individual differences in propensity to plan that can be adapted to different domains and used to compare planning across domains and time horizons.
instructions: Please indicate how frequently or infrequently you currently have each experience.
reference: Lynch Jr, J. G., Netemeyer, R. G., Spiller, S. A., & Zammit, A. (2010). A generalizable scale of propensity to plan: The long and the short of planning for time and for money. Journal of consumer research, 37(1), 108-128. https://doi.org/10.1086/649907
